p: This document describes how to upgrade a server from release 2.3.0 to release 2.4.0 of Hedgehog via packages.

p.span: If desired, back up the existing installation (the directory structure in the User Guide is a useful reference) and database.

p: Stop refile and grok cron job running:

ac:structured-macro.ac:plain-text-body: sudo -u hedgehog crontab -e # Import XML data every 15 mins # 00,15,30,45 * * * * <prefix>/bin/refile_and_grok.sh -c >> /var/log/hedgehog/refile_and_grok_xml_to_db.sh.log 2>&1

p: Comment out any other jobs that are about to run. If the dsc-extractor process is running wait for it to finish before continuing.
It is recommended to disable the web front end during upgrade e.g by enabling a holding page.

ac:structured-macro.ac:plain-text-body: sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get upgrade

h3: 2.3 Run the manage_partitions script for this month and next month

p.span: Setup the database partitions for the new dataset. Do this for the current month and for next month.

p: Once this script has been run then add the new dataset to the dsc.conf file if desired:

ac:structured-macro.ac:plain-text-body: dataset server_addr_vs_trans dns Transport:transport ServerAddr:server queries-only;

p: There is a new configuration option available in the hedgehog_gui.yaml file in 2.4

ac:structured-macro.ac:plain-text-body: enable_node_selection : 1 # '1' -> true, Show the node radio button # '0' -> false, hide the node radio button

p: In 2.4 there is a new (optional) field introduced into nodes.csv 'rename-or-remove'. This enables nodes to either be renamed (also updating the data directory on disk) or removed from the database (data on disk is left untouched). For more information see the usage of the database_update_nodes script and the latest nodes.csv file.
Re-enable and test the web front end. Make sure to restart apache.
Restart refile and grok cron job running:

ac:structured-macro.ac:plain-text-body: sudo -u hedgehog crontab -e # Import XML data every 15 mins 00,15,30,45 * * * * /usr/bin/refile_and_grok -c >> /var/log/hedgehog/refile_and_grok_xml_to_db.log 2>&1

p: Re-enable any other jobs that were disabled for the upgrade.
